name: Slowbro

abilities.name: Strange Behavior
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to Slowbro as long as you don't Knock Out Slowbro. This power can't be used if Slowbro is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: The Shellder that is latched onto Slowpoke's tail is said to feed on the host's left-over scraps.

strengths: Strange Behavior can protect key Pokemon by absorbing damage
Excellent synergy with Alakazam's Damage Swap
weaknesses: Only 60 HP limits how much damage can be absorbed

competitiveHistory: Slowbro was a crucial component of the 'Damage Swap' archetype alongside Alakazam. Strange Behavior allowed players to consolidate damage on Slowbro from their other Pokemon, then use Alakazam's Damage Swap to move it to an opponent's Pokemon or heal with Pokemon Center/Scoop Up. This created a powerful control strategy that was a competitive force until Muk became widespread.

rulings.ruling: Strange Behavior can be used multiple times per turn - 'as often as you like' means unlimited uses.
You cannot move a damage counter to Slowbro if it would knock Slowbro out.
Damage counters can only be moved from your own Pokemon to Slowbro, not from opponent's Pokemon.
Multiple Slowbros can each use Strange Behavior independently.
